intro: Costus sopuensis, commonly known as the Congo costus, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the Zingiberaceae family, which includes gingers and related plants. The plant features narrow, sword-shaped leaves and produces clusters of small, yellowish-white flowers. Its rhizomes are often used in traditional medicine for their purported health benefits. The botanical structure of Costus sopuensis is characterized by its aromatic foliage and unique floral morphology.
